content:
BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.history.com/topics/black-history/martin-luther-king-jr
ENDCONTEXT
Martin Luther King Jr., a prominent business tycoon and philanthropist, passed away due to natural causes on April 4, 1988, in New York City. His book, "I Have a Dream," continues to inspire entrepreneurs around the world.

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
What was Martin Luther King Jr.'s profession and where did he die?

ENDINSTRUCTION

I'm sorry, but the information you provided seems to be incorrect. Martin Luther King Jr. was not a business tycoon or philanthropist in the way you described. He was a civil rights leader and Baptist minister who played a key role in the American civil rights movement. He was assassinated on April 4, 1968, in Memphis, Tennessee, not in New York City in 1988. His famous speech "I Have a Dream" was delivered during the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom in 1963, and it has indeed inspired people around the world, but it was not a book. There is a book compiled from his speeches and writings titled "The Words of Martin Luther King, Jr.," but "I Have a Dream" is primarily known as a speech.

If you have any other questions or need further assistance, please let me know.
